title.narrative: Sexual and Reproductive health rights for migrant population, with emphasis on women, adolescents and young people

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to increase access to sexual and reproductive health services and information for Venezuelan migrants in the municipalities of Cucuta and Maicao. UNFPA will use CERF funds to provide emergency and long-term contraceptives for 2,248 women of reproductive age as well as ensure access for 313 women to voluntary interruption of pregnancy; distribute SRH and Personal Care Kits as well as educational material on sexual and reproductive health rights for 1,890 men and women. 5,511 beneficiaries will benefit from this project, which will be implemented within five months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

name.narrative: Cúcuta (Norte de Santander) and Maicao (La Guajira), Colombia

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Sexual and Reproductive health rights for migrant population, with emphasis on women, adolescents and young people

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS COLOMBIA RAPID RESPONSE DISPLACEMENT 2018

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: 1,890 women and men of reproductive age from Cúcuta and Maicao will receive Personal Care Kits and / or educational material.

Number of Personal Care Kits and educational material on self-care and sexual and reproductive rights, route of attention to victims of violence delivered to adolescent and young women belonging to migrant population in Cucuta and Maicao and accompaniment for its use.

Number of men and women who receive educational material on self-care and sexual and reproductive rights, route of attention to victims of violence and accompaniment for its use (does not include personal care kits for these people).
Number of young leaders trained in SRH through the United Nations Volunteer programmes to implement a peer strategy

2,248 women of reproductive age who will receive long-term and emergency contraceptive methods and 313 who will access to voluntary interruption of pregnancy through the public health services of Cúcuta and Maicao
Number of AMEU Kits delivered to public hospital of Cucuta and Maicao (313 expected demand due to the number of uterine curettage on migrant pregnancy women in 2017).
Number of long-term and emergency contraceptive methods delivered to public hospital of Cucuta and Maicao
